page.title: 06ROBERT HALL FARM - THE HERD
page.content: The stock at Robert Hall farm comprises 80 milking cows, 20 heifers (2 years old) 20 heifers (1 year old) 20 friesian bulls (beef) and 30 beef-cross calves (beef). In 1980 the milking herd stood at 40 cows. This number has since doubled and would have reached 100 but for the EEC restrictions. Mr Hope had to look for an alternative to milking cows and turned to beef; he is also considering sheep. The milk produced at Robert Hall goes to the Milk Marketing Board at Settle. Mr Hope is paid 14.838p a litre which includes a set price for each constituent in the milk. Dairy farming used to be a more profitable business than other farming and the regular income is still a great help. Owing to the EEC cuts many things have had to change. Mr Hope is coping but his income is static.
